name: String length
title: String length in Java
description: Returns the number of characters in a string using the length() method.

syntax.parameters: str: a non-null String whose length you want to know.
syntax.returns: int: number of characters in the string.

code_examples.title: Basic length usage
code_examples.explanation: length() returns the total number of characters, including spaces.

code_examples.title: Check empty string
code_examples.explanation: Use length() == 0 to test for an empty string.

code_examples.title: Loop over characters
code_examples.explanation: Use length() to control a loop that visits every character.

usage_notes: length() is a method, so you must use parentheses: str.length().
length() counts all characters, including spaces and punctuation.
For arrays, use field .length (no parentheses), not length().

gotchas.wrong_code:
String s = "Hi";
int len = s.length; // compile error
gotchas.explanation: For String, length is a method; you must call it with parentheses.

gotchas.mistake: Calling length() on a null reference
gotchas.wrong_code:
String s = null;
int len = s.length(); // NullPointerException
gotchas.explanation: Always ensure the string is not null before calling length().
